title: Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site: Annual Spiritual Healing Run-Walk
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Annual Spiritual Healing Run-Walk            Annual Spiritual Healing Run-Walk       The Annual Spiritual Healing Run/Walk Event The Sand Creek Massacre Spiritual Healing Run/Walk Event is an annual event sponsored by the Northern Cheyenne Tribe of Montana, the Northern Arapaho Tribe of Wyoming, and the Southern Cheyenne and Arapaho Tribes (Oklahoma) to honor the victims and survivors of the Sand Creek Massacre and for healing of ancestral homelands.   The event begins at the Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site with a sunrise ceremony at the Monument Hill Overlook in the morning. Immediately following the ceremony, Cheyenne, Arapaho and non-tribal runners gather for the first leg of a four day run/walk to Denver, where they join other tribal members and supporters for a tribute to Captain Silas S. Soule and Lieutenant Joseph Cramer. The event culminates with a public gathering and presentation of state, federal and tribal officials at the state capital.    Dates and activities associated with the Spiritual Healing Run/Walk Event are subject to change. For the latest information regarding this annual event go to the News Page.
